services.name: Crop
services.description: Reduces the length of your jacket while maintaining the original finish and shape where possible.

questions.question: Does your jacket have a zip along the front?
questions.explainer: To shorten the jacket we will need to remove a zip along the front shorten this and re-attach it to fit the cropped jacket.

services.name: Shorten sleeves
services.description: Alters the sleeve length from the cuff while maintaining the original finish and shape where possible.

services.name: Take in from sides
services.description: Reduces the width through the side seams or back seams to create a more flattering look, this can be altered by a maximum of 2 inches. Please note, any original vent features (i.e. openings at the back of the jacket) will not be replicated with this service.

questions.question: Does your jacket have lining?
questions.explainer: This is a layer of material inside your jacket which is different to the outer layer

services.name: Narrow shoulders
services.description: Narrowing the shoulder seam up to a max of half an inch to ensure the original shape and balance of the jacket.

questions.question: Would you like us to source material from your jacket

subservices.description: Repairs a single tear or damage along a seam, where the pieces of fabric are stitched together. subservices.name: Plain finish shortening
subservices.description: Reduces the length of your jeans with a plain finish where the hem is folded and stitched with a close matching thread to the original. This finish is recommend on plain coloured (i.e white, red, black etc), patterned and strech jeans.

subservices.name: Original finish
subservices.description: Reduces the length of your jeans with an original finish where the hem is reattached with a seam and binded back on. This finish is recommend where the hem has "distressed wear". We do not recommend this finish on plain coloured (i.e white, red, black etc), patterned and stretch jeans.
